meanings.definition: An ancient Roman central heating system in which hot air circulated under the floor and through the walls of a building.
meanings.sent1: The hypocaust in the Roman villa kept the rooms warm during the cold winters.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered the remains of a hypocaust while excavating the ancient bathhouse.
meanings.sent3: The hypocaust decided to take a break from heating the floor and went on strike!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a hypocaust, spreading warmth and comfort to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The hypocaust hummed softly, like a hidden engine beneath the marble floors.
